article:
The 'history of science and technology in the [[Indian Subcontinent]]' begins
with prehistoric human activity at Mehrgarh, in present-day Pakistan, and
continues through the Indus Valley Civilization to early states and empires. The
British colonial rule introduced some elements of western education in India.
Following independence science and technology in the Republic of India has
included automobile engineering, information technology, communications as well
as space, polar, and nuclear sciences.
categories: History of science and technology in India|
History of science and technology in Pakistan|
